intro: Phlomoides popovii, commonly known as the Mongolian phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky environments and is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and are clustered in whorls along the stems. Phlomoides popovii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
